result.execSummary:
The defendant Dylan R Everson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Dylan R Everson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Dylan R Everson was found guilty of Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $200 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted.  $67 VW surcharge to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.

Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with MC until written consent from agent. Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Follow through with drug court in Sauk Co. Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  DNA on file. Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

Copy of minutes from PLEAS Hrg on 8/11/22 sent electronically to DCJ and DOC
Notice of right to seek postconviction relief
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.

*** IN CUSTODY ***

11:31 AM Defendant in court with Attorney Cynthia J. Fiene .  ADA Carl Jacob Lazarus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of right to and waived Preliminary Hearing (Preliminary Hearing Waiver signed); Court accepted waiver of Preliminary Hearing and ordered case bound over.
Preliminary hearing on August 2, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process if required. 
- Defendant shall not be at any Fleet Farm store in Dane County. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Mackenzie F or Jade V. 
- Defendant shall not discuss the facts of this case with Mandy C. 
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 2

02:00 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Amy M Johnson.  Trisha L Simmons appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
